intro: Zephyranthes lagesiana, commonly known as the Lagesian rain lily, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in response to rainfall. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in shaded to partially sunny conditions. Its bulbs are underground, allowing it to survive periods of drought. Zephyranthes lagesiana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and its ability to bloom throughout the year in suitable climates.
